definition[0]: to change an arrangement so that something happens sooner
example[0]: The meeting’s been brought forward to Thursday.
definition[1]: to officially introduce plans etc for people to discuss
example[1]: The government has brought forward new proposals to tackle the problem of increasing crime.
definition[2]: to record the result of a calculation so that it can be used in a further calculation
definition[3]: if you bring forward a meeting or other event that is going to take place in the future, you arrange for it to take place at an earlier time
example[3]: The next departmental meeting has been brought forward to the 10th.
definition[4]: to move the total from a set of numbers that you are calculating onto the next page, so that you can add or take away other numbers from it
example[4]: The balance brought forward from the previous bank statement is £356.78.
